events.name: History and revival of electric vehicles
events.wd_label: History and revival of electric vehicles
events.wd_description: Electric vehicles (EVs) were popular in the early 1900s, with significant advancements made by Thomas Davenport and widespread use in cities like New York. The mass-produced gas-powered Model T by Henry Ford in 1908 led to a decline in EVs until their recent revival.
events.description: Electric vehicles (EVs) were popular in the early 1900s, with significant advancements made by Thomas Davenport and widespread use in cities like New York. The mass-produced gas-powered Model T by Henry Ford in 1908 led to a decline in EVs until their recent revival.

events.name: Early EV development
events.wd_description: Thomas Davenport built the first electric vehicle in 1835, and by 1900, EVs were a common sight, with New York operating a fleet of electric taxis.
events.description: Thomas Davenport built the first electric vehicle in 1835, and by 1900, EVs were a common sight, with New York operating a fleet of electric taxis.

events.name: Thomas Davenport
events.wd_description: Thomas Davenport is credited with building the first electric vehicle in 1835.
events.description: Thomas Davenport is credited with building the first electric vehicle in 1835.

events.name: New York electric taxis
events.wd_description: By 1900, New York had a fleet of electric taxis, with electric cars making up one-third of all vehicles on the road.
events.description: By 1900, New York had a fleet of electric taxis, with electric cars making up one-third of all vehicles on the road.

events.name: Mass production of gas-powered vehicles
events.wd_description: The introduction of the mass-produced gas-powered Model T by Henry Ford in 1908 marked the decline of electric vehicles.
events.description: The introduction of the mass-produced gas-powered Model T by Henry Ford in 1908 marked the decline of electric vehicles.

events.name: Henry Ford
events.wd_description: Henry Ford introduced the mass-produced gas-powered Model T in 1908.
events.description: Henry Ford introduced the mass-produced gas-powered Model T in 1908.

events.name: Model T
events.wd_description: The Model T symbolized the end of the early age of electric cars and the rise of gas-powered vehicles.
events.description: The Model T symbolized the end of the early age of electric cars and the rise of gas-powered vehicles.

events.name: Recent EV revival
events.wd_description: The recent revival of electric vehicles is revolutionizing the automotive industry ecosystem, leading to revised business strategies, new technologies, and reconfigured supply chains.
events.description: The recent revival of electric vehicles is revolutionizing the automotive industry ecosystem, leading to revised business strategies, new technologies, and reconfigured supply chains.

events.name: Business strategies
events.wd_description: Automotive industry players are revising their business strategies to adapt to the EV revolution.
events.description: Automotive industry players are revising their business strategies to adapt to the EV revolution.

events.name: New technologies
events.wd_description: The development of new technologies is crucial for the growth of the electric vehicle industry.
events.description: The development of new technologies is crucial for the growth of the electric vehicle industry.

events.name: Supply chains
events.wd_description: Global supply chains and manufacturing footprints are being reconfigured to support the EV revolution.
events.description: Global supply chains and manufacturing footprints are being reconfigured to support the EV revolution.

events.name: Access to raw materials
events.wd_description: Securing access to battery raw materials is essential for the sustained growth of the electric vehicle industry.
events.description: Securing access to battery raw materials is essential for the sustained growth of the electric vehicle industry.

events.name: Impact of EV revolution on battery raw materials
events.wd_label: Impact of EV revolution on battery raw materials
events.wd_description: The electric vehicle revolution has led to a dramatic increase in the prices of key battery commodities like lithium and cobalt, raising concerns about future supply availability and production costs.
events.description: The electric vehicle revolution has led to a dramatic increase in the prices of key battery commodities like lithium and cobalt, raising concerns about future supply availability and production costs.

events.name: Lithium price increase
events.wd_description: The price of lithium has significantly increased over the past 24 months due to the growing demand for electric vehicles and energy storage.
events.description: The price of lithium has significantly increased over the past 24 months due to the growing demand for electric vehicles and energy storage.

events.name: Cobalt price increase
events.wd_description: The price of cobalt has also dramatically increased, reflecting its importance in battery production.
events.description: The price of cobalt has also dramatically increased, reflecting its importance in battery production.

events.name: Demand for energy storage
events.wd_description: The growing need for energy storage, e-bikes, and other battery-intensive applications is increasing interest in lithium and cobalt.
events.description: The growing need for energy storage, e-bikes, and other battery-intensive applications is increasing interest in lithium and cobalt.

events.name: Strategic responses
events.wd_description: Different industry players need to develop robust strategies to address the complexities and dynamics of the rapidly changing battery raw materials market.
events.description: Different industry players need to develop robust strategies to address the complexities and dynamics of the rapidly changing battery raw materials market.

events.name: Automotive OEMs
events.wd_description: Automotive OEMs need to understand the market dynamics and develop strategies to secure raw material supplies.
events.description: Automotive OEMs need to understand the market dynamics and develop strategies to secure raw material supplies.

events.name: Battery manufacturers
events.wd_description: Battery manufacturers must adapt to the changing market conditions and ensure a stable supply of raw materials.
events.description: Battery manufacturers must adapt to the changing market conditions and ensure a stable supply of raw materials.

events.name: Mining companies
events.wd_description: Mining and refining companies play a critical role in the supply of lithium and cobalt for battery production.
events.description: Mining and refining companies play a critical role in the supply of lithium and cobalt for battery production.

events.name: Financial investors
events.wd_description: Financial investors need to understand the complexities of the battery raw materials market to make informed investment decisions.
events.description: Financial investors need to understand the complexities of the battery raw materials market to make informed investment decisions.

events.name: Future demand for lithium and cobalt
events.wd_label: Future demand for lithium and cobalt
events.wd_description: The adoption of electric vehicles is driving a significant increase in the demand for lithium and cobalt, with forecasts indicating substantial growth in these markets by 2025.
events.description: The adoption of electric vehicles is driving a significant increase in the demand for lithium and cobalt, with forecasts indicating substantial growth in these markets by 2025.

events.name: Lithium demand
events.wd_description: The demand for lithium is expected to increase more than threefold from 214 kt to 669 kt LCE between 2017 and 2025.
events.description: The demand for lithium is expected to increase more than threefold from 214 kt to 669 kt LCE between 2017 and 2025.

events.name: Cobalt demand
events.wd_description: The demand for cobalt is projected to increase by 60 percent from 136 kt to 222 kt over the same period.
events.description: The demand for cobalt is projected to increase by 60 percent from 136 kt to 222 kt over the same period.

events.name: Li-ion battery technology
events.wd_description: Li-ion battery technology is expected to remain the prevalent battery technology for the foreseeable future, driving demand for lithium and cobalt.
events.description: Li-ion battery technology is expected to remain the prevalent battery technology for the foreseeable future, driving demand for lithium and cobalt.

events.name: Early Popularity of Electric Vehicles
events.description: In the early 1900s, electric vehicles (EVs) were popular in Europe and the United States, with electric taxis in New York and claims that some EVs could travel 100 miles on a single charge.

events.name: Lithium and Cobalt Price Increases
events.description: The prices of lithium and cobalt have dramatically increased over the past 24 months due to the EV revolution and growing demand for energy storage and other battery-intensive applications.

events.name: Divergent Futures for Lithium and Cobalt
events.description: Recent concerns about the future availability of raw materials for batteries and the impact of rising commodity prices on battery production costs have highlighted risks that may create divergent futures for lithium and cobalt.

events.name: Strategic Responses to Raw Material Supply Challenges
events.description: The strategic response to raw material supply challenges will differ across industry players, including automotive OEMs, battery manufacturers, mining companies, and financial investors. Understanding market dynamics is crucial for developing robust strategies.

events.name: Projected Demand for Lithium and Cobalt
events.description: The growing adoption of EVs and the need for batteries with higher energy densities are projected to increase lithium demand more than threefold and cobalt demand by 60 percent between 2017 and 2025.
